content: If Nigeria where to accept bitcoin as its national currency would this help our country's current economy and how

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: Thehallows on August 15, 2023, 10:44:19 AMIf Nigeria where to accept bitcoin as its national currency would this help our country's current economy and how OP I see you are a newbie here. It is nice you initiated a topic of discussion unlike back then when we came on board, it took us a little time before we could start creating a thread to start a topic or commenting and looking at the numerous things we need to learn and getting knowledge about here but notwithstanding, learning is a gradual process which one needs to undergo before perfection. But however, what you have asked here is very much important though.Nigerian  government I think would not buy into the idea of making Bitcoin a national currency but I believe it would be accepted as an alternative in the sense that it could serve as an alternative means of payment between customers, businesses, and others as a digital currency and would be raking in revenue from transactions involving bitcoin payments and deals. Nigeria's government so far has been of the opinion of making her national currency more strengthened and valuable so therefore anything that would alter her course would be strongly opposed. Have you not heard of the news of the Bureau de Change calling on the federal government to ban Binance that has nothing to do with our currency devaluation?The economy of a nation does not really depends on its currency but on what policies they have put in place to strengthen the economic and bilateral trading relationship with other foreign nations. What does a country have to offer to the world in terms of production and export? Being a consuming nation adds no value to her economy and currency so therefore  even if bitcoin is accepted as an alternative currency, it has no effect on the economy instead  her citizens would opt for it as a store of value to do away with her currency devaluation and economic inflation.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Thehallows on August 15, 2023, 10:44:19 AMIf Nigeria where to accept bitcoin as its national currency would this help our country's current economy and how It will not help. What is affecting Nigeria is their dependency on importations. We import than we export. We import than we supposed to be producing and add more value to our GDP. comments.author: Broadanbig
comments.body: I do not think that would be possible for Bitcoin to help our economy.  The economy has long been on a decay years before Bitcoin was invented as a result of bad governance. Our leaders are really not ready to go beyond their horizons to settle the economic challenges of our nation. Corruption has eaten deep into the system that it is now normalised.  It is a  "you chop I chop" thing for any government that comes into power.As you have said pertaining to Bitcoin being accepted as a national currency, Bitcoin as we all know is a digital currency and most people also see it as a store of value so therefore just like one of the replies I read here said that most Nigerians would opt for Bitcoin as a store of value to avoid a loss or devaluation on their assets. They would do this to protect their own interests and investment not until the economy is stable and it would be of good advantage for them because if Bitcoin price increases they have profit to earn as well.The problem Nigeria has with her economy is that the system is not functioning normal to boost production which lies on the policies formulated by the powers that be. The production sectors is in a camatose making the nation over dependent on imports than exporting her own produce. All these put together affects the economy negatively and as a matter of fact, it results to currency devaluation and economic inflation.So therefore, the fact that Bitcoin could help Nigeria current situation is a "fallacy of misconceptions."

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: No be when a country accept the usage of something, no be when dem go d talk about the complete usage of am?As em d so, Nigeria never openly legalize bitcoin, talk more of accepting it as a national currency. Make our government legalize am first, and we don use am for year's, we go now begin reason whether em go d essential to use as national currency or not. As you don ask the question already as a newbie wey you be, the answer to question na big no. Bitcoin no way connect to a country's  economy. Wetin the boost a country's economy na when the use more of their locally made product than depending more on imported goods. Since we depend more on imported goods than exporting ours to the outside world or even try to d use more of our locally made product, how you think sae our economy go grow? Na when we go begin to learn on how to start to d use or produce more of our locally product, na when our economy go begin grow. As for bitcoin, em no for once help a country economy.
